description:
Ochropleura plecta, commonly known as the Flame Shoulder moth, is a species of noctuid moth found in Europe and Asia. It belongs to the family Noctuidae, which includes a large number of night-flying moths.

The Flame Shoulder moth has a wingspan of approximately 30-35 millimeters. Its forewings are reddish-brown in color, with a distinctive orange-red patch near the base, giving the appearance of a "flame" on the shoulder. The hindwings are greyish-brown.

The larvae, or caterpillars, of the Flame Shoulder moth are typically greyish-brown in color, with a distinct pattern of dark lines and spots along their bodies. They feed on a variety of herbaceous plants, including dandelions, docks, and plantains.

The Flame Shoulder moth is a common and widespread species, and it plays a role in the ecosystem as a pollinator and a food source for predators such as birds and bats. It is an important component of the nocturnal insect community in many regions.
